title: 2 Easy Ways to Change the Ringtone for an Alarm on Android

steps.title: Open the Clock app.
steps.content: Open the Clock app. Tap the app icon that looks like a clock. This app looks slightly different on different Android models but functions similarly.

steps.title: Tap Alarm.
steps.content: Tap Alarm . It's a tab in the lower-left corner of your screen and will list all your alarms.

steps.title: Tap an alarm that you want to edit.
steps.content: Tap an alarm that you want to edit. Tap + if you want to create a new alarm.

steps.title: Tap Alarm Sound.
steps.content: Tap Alarm Sound . This is the noise the alarm makes to notify you.

steps.title: Choose if you want to use a ringtone or Spotify.
steps.content: Choose if you want to use a ringtone or Spotify. Tapping this will bring you to a list of different ringtones that you have on your phone. If you use third-party apps like Zedge , you can download the sounds you want to use. That way, you can use a catchy phrase from a show you like as your alarm sounds.

steps.title: Tap a ringtone you want to set as your alarm sounds.
steps.content: Tap a ringtone you want to set as your alarm sounds. Drag the slider at the bottom of the screen to change how loud or soft the alarm is, and use the toggles to further customize how it sounds. If you have a sound file that doesn't appear in this list, tap + to search for it and use it.

steps.title: Tap the back arrow twice.
steps.content: Tap the back arrow twice. You'll find in the top left corner and in the nav bar at the bottom of your screen.

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . This will save any changes you made to the alarm. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Google Clock app.
steps.content: Open the Google Clock app. Tap the app that features a blue analog clock with white arms. This app isn't default for many Android phones, but using it is the easiest. All you need to do is download Clock by Google, LLC from the Google Play Store and open it to use it.

steps.title: Tap the alarm you want to edit.
steps.content: Tap the alarm you want to edit. This will open the settings page for the selected alarm. [3] X Research source Alternatively, you can tap Add and create a new alarm preset.

steps.title: Tap Default.
steps.content: Tap Default . It's the icon of a bell and lists the name of your current sound. This will open a list of all the available alarm sounds you can use. [4] X Research source On some versions, this button may be named Ringtone .

steps.title: Select the alarm tone you want to use.
steps.content: Select the alarm tone you want to use. Find the ringtone you want to hear when your alarm goes off and tap its name on the list. [5] X Research source Some devices allow you to select music as your alarm ringtone. In this case, tap the music service you want to use, like YouTube Music or Spotify. You can only use music from Calm, Spotify, Pandora, and YouTube Music. Any music services you're signed into on your phone will appear as options. If you want to add your own ringtone, tap the " + " icon. This way, you can select any sound file and set it as your custom alarm ringtone. Once you select the music or alarm sound, your choice is saved so you can close the app as soon as you're finished without needing to worry about saving first. [6] X Research source Make sure the toggle next to the alarm name is on (colored).
